meanings.sent1: The solar panel produced only a few milliwatts of electricity.
meanings.sent2: The flashlight bulb required several milliwatts to shine brightly.
meanings.sent3: The tiny toy car moved sluggishly with just a few milliwatts of power.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was barely a whisper, like a milliwatt in a sea of watts.
meanings.sent5: The milliwatts of energy were barely enough to power the small clock.

meanings.definition: A unit of power equal to one thousandth of a watt.
meanings.sent1: The electronic device consumed only a fraction of a milliwatt.
meanings.sent2: The radio transmitter emitted several milliwatts of signal strength.
meanings.sent3: The old computer struggled to function with such low milliwatts of power.
meanings.sent4: His influence was like a milliwatt in a world of megawatts.
meanings.sent5: The milliwatts of electricity were insufficient to operate the large machinery.
